thread.title: NFC West watch: Cardinals eye 4-1 start
thread.title_full: NFC West watch: Cardinals eye 4-1 start | The Seattle Times

author: Seattle Times staff
title: NFC West watch: Cardinals eye 4-1 start
text:
Arizona Cardinals Record: 3-1.
This week: At Detroit Lions, 1:05 p.m.
Last week: Lost to St. Louis, 24-22.
Notable: The Cardinals might not be as good as they looked in their roaring 3-0 start this season, but don’t let last week’s loss fool you. The Cardinals had twice as many first downs, 119 more total yards and held onto the ball for five minutes longer than the Rams. The difference? The Cardinals had three turnovers. This is still a good and dangerous team, regardless of what last week’s score might indicate on the surface.
St. Louis Rams Most Read Stories Expect traffic delays when Obama visits Seattle Friday afternoon Huskies upset USC 17-12 and beat Steve Sarkisian, their former coach Win over USC puts UW’s coaching upgrade (Chris Petersen over Steve Sarkisian) on full display Lloyd McClendon will not return as Mariners' manager Even in death, 'Up' house owner Edith Macefield remains a mystery Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. Record: 2-2.
This week: At Green Bay, 10 a.m.
Last week: Beat Arizona, 24-22.
Notable: It’s just one game, but Rams rookie running back Todd Gurley looked like he could be the next great NFL running back with his first breakout performance as a pro. He rushed for 146 yards on 19 carries, but 106 of those yards came in the fourth quarter. He entered the NFL surrounded by hype and lived up to it last week. 
San Francisco 49ers Record: 1-3.
This week: At New York Giants, 5:30 p.m.
Last week: Lost to Green Bay, 17-3.
Notable: Not to beat a dead horse, but things just aren’t working out for quarterback Colin Kaepernick in San Francisco. In his past two games, Kaepernick has thrown for just 227 yards, no touchdowns and has five interceptions. Every week, it seems, coach Jim Tomsula is answering questions about Kaepernick’s future.
Jayson Jenks
